bestBHT.bht: When I had fastened my eyes, I considered and saw in a flash a multitude of all kinds of animals. It was something strange and unusual, coming down from heaven and engrossing all my thoughts. I pondered on what it meant, inspecting and reflecting on what I saw. In that moment, standing or walking upon it were four-footed beasts of the earth, wild beasts, creeping things, and fowls of the air. It was a vision that challenged my previous understanding and prompted me to think deeply about its significance.

Marvin Vincent: I considered. See on Matthew 8:3; Luke 22:24, Luke 22:27.
Philip Schaff: Upon which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered...the fact that he deliberately inspected and reflected on what he saw in the trance.
It adds to the emphasis of the surprise felt by him on contemplating a multitude of all kinds of animals, and hearing a command giving sanction for his eating of them indiscriminately.
Archibald T. Robertson: When I had fastened my eyes (ατενισας). This personal touch Peter adds from his own experience."
I considered (κατανοεω). Imperfect active of κατανεοω to put the mind down on, to ponder, I was pondering."
And saw (κα ειδον). Second aorist active indicative, saw in a flash.
John Gill: Upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes... Not of his body, but of his mind... not knowing whether in the body or out of it."

Being intent upon this object, he considered in his mind what it was, and what it should mean; it being something strange and unusual; which came down from heaven, and out of it, and came so close and near to him, that it engrossed all his thoughts, and was the subject of deep meditation.
Saw four-footed beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air; not pourtrayed upon the sheet, but standing or walking upon it.

When I had fastened my eyes, I considered and saw in a flash a multitude of all kinds of animals. It was something strange and unusual, engrossing all my thoughts, prompting deep meditation. Standing or walking upon it were four-footed beasts of the earth, wild beasts, creeping things, and fowls of the air. This vision challenged my previous understanding, leading me to inspect and reflect upon its significance. It was a moment that caused me to ponder on the meaning behind this divine revelation.
